uh the thing that stands out here is that it uses a map for a list of all of the queries that can be executed uh so
each query has a name and then a SQL state and then at the beginning in the init it
um parses those queries and prepares them so that they're it runs the DB prepare so you don't have the two round
trips to the server when you make a query so everything is pre-prepared
which saves a lot of time during runtime um I don't know if it's any more or less
elegant than any other solution I've seen but I do like the idea of all of the queries being in a single map so
they're easy to find in the source code they're not littered through functions and I do very much like the idea of
preparing them ahead of time so that they're faster because in case you aren't aware uh when you write a query
in go using DB SQL uh I think at least my SQL and I'm not sure about the other
drivers they in the background will run a prepare on the query first and then execute it so it's two round trips to
the server even when you think you're making one so preparing them in advance saves quite a bit of time
